title: TiKV Panic: lock_count_modify should never be negative, start_ts:xxx
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
master
Git Commit Hash:   e278928817ed4007279f90c7bf8e42c9b02213f2

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
X86, K8s

### Steps to reproduce
1. br restore full to upstream and downstream TiDB 
```
/br  restore  full "-s" "s3://qe-testing/nfs/tools_test_data/BR-sysbench-tmp?access-key=xxx&secret-access-key=xxx&endpoint=xxx&provider=ks" "-u" "http://upstream-pd.cdc-testbed-tps-7596283-1-136:2379" "--check-requirem
ents=false"
```
2. Create TiDB sink changefeed
3. Run workload
```
sysbench --db-driver=mysql --mysql-host='upstream-tidb.cdc-testbed-tps-7596283-1-136'  --mysql-port=4000 --mysql-user=root --mysql-db=workload --tables=30 --table-size=100000 --create_secondary=off --time=600 --debug=true --threads=30 --mysql-ignore-errors=2013,1213,1105,1205,8022,8027,8028,9004,9007,1062 oltp_write_only run
```

### What did you expect?
Workload should run without error

### What did happened?
Workload error, and check tikv log, panic seen on upstream TiKV.
```
ATAL: mysql_stmt_execute() returned error 9005 (Regi
on is unavailable) for query 'UPDATE sbtest6 SET c=? WHERE id=?'\n
```
